content.title: Daniel Svendsén
content.description: Result-driven Full-Stack Developer with leadership background, specialized in Java, Spring Boot and React.

content.title: Hobbies
content.description: Photography with own business, cooking, brewing beer, baking sourdough bread, fishing, and enjoying nature trips with my family.

content.title: Introduction
content.description: Motivated and versatile full-stack/system developer with a background in leadership and technical problem-solving. Studied Java Enterprise Developer program at Yrgo for 2 years. Passionate about designing scalable applications, improving workflows, and collaborating in Agile teams.

skills.tool: Leadership, Mentorship, Teamwork, Communication, Problem-Solving, Adaptability, Critical Thinking

experience.details:
Internship - Full-Stack Developer at Alten (for Save the Children). Developing an open-source platform during a 27-week internship to enhance Hjulverkstan's community services.
        - Contributed to full-stack development using Java, Spring Boot (backend), React, TypeScript (frontend), and AWS S3, focusing on delivering a critical image management system.
        - Designed and implemented a comprehensive image handling solution: built scalable backend APIs for image upload/deletion to S3 with an automated cleanup service, and developed a mobile-first portal interface for efficient image capture by workshop staff. This directly improved internal vehicle tracking and management.
        - Developed and launched key features for a new public-facing MVP website, including dynamic display of available vehicles and workshop information with images. This significantly increased Hjulverkstan's online visibility and accessibility to the community.
        - The integrated solution provided a robust, user-centric platform, laying a scalable foundation for future development and directly supporting Hjulverkstan's operational and outreach goals.
        - Utilized GitHub for version control and collaboration within an Agile (Scrum/Kanban) team.

ICA - Warehouse worker, various roles including:
Team leader - Ability to change tactics depending on what the day brings
Peer supporter - Helping colleagues in tough situations and/or addictions
Teaching - Teaching colleagues how to operate truck/use system to achieve goals
Improvement team - Work on improvement suggestions received from employees
Goods recipient - Recieving goods from trucks and ensuring proper system entry
Java Enterprise Developer, Yrgo, Gothenburg (400 YH points)

projects.name: Personal Website & CV
projects.details: Built the website for my photography company and this dynamic CV page using React, Vite, and Tailwind CSS. Features include dynamic PDF generation, responsive design, and fetching CV data from a database. Hosted on Cloudflare Pages with CI/CD via GitHub Actions; backend and database deployed on Railway.

projects.name: Receptobot
projects.details: Developed Receptobot, an AI-powered service generating recipes via OpenAI's API based on user input (ingredients, allergies, cuisine). Requires login (5 fetches/user) and possibility to save recipes to users profilepage. Backend: Spring Boot with Bucket4j (rate-limiting). Frontend: React, Vite, Tailwind CSS. Deployed on Railway with Cloudflare DNS.

projects.name: TapMap
projects.details: Developed the frontend for TapMap, a location-based service concept displaying nearby restaurants/bars alongside real-time sun position data using React, Vite, Tailwind CSS, and Leaflet. Features include an interactive map, location data fetching, user ratings, and price tracking.
